page.title: 09ESSO PIPELINE - WINSON
page.content: During the 1980's the Esso Oil Co. laid an underground oilpipe from their refinery at Fawley to Wolverhampton, a distance of about 200 miles. After all the preliminary problems about the exact location and compensation had been solved, a strip of land 20 yd. wide was fenced off, excavated to a depth of 8 ft., the l8" dia. steel pipe laid down, and finally the top soil replaced. Every effort was made by Esso to avoid known archaeological sites, but various hitherto unknown sites have been found on the line, including a substantial early to middle iron age site in Winson parish, high above the Coln.This was described as a hillfort with a large defensive ditch. Evidence was found of substantial timber houses, storage pits, pottery, a grindstone and a brooch.
